{"title":"page 28","subjec":{},"descri":{},"creato":{},"publis":{},"date":{},"year":{},"format":{},"reposi":{},"collec":{},"reposa":{},"rights":{},"digitb":{},"langua":{},"topics":{},"cite":{},"notes":{},"notesa":{},"source":{},"box":{},"folder":{},"identi":{},"relati":{},"findin":{},"catalo":{},"type":{},"full":"28
Sec. 8. He shall strictly watch the conduct of
all persons of known bad character, and in such
manner that it will be evident to said persons that
■they are watched, and that certain detection must
follow the attempt to commit crime; ho shall note
the time of the appearance of any person of known
bad character on his beat, and the circumstances
attending, and the premises that said person may
enter, and report to the commanding officer.
Sec. 9. When any person charges another with
the commission of a crime, and insists that the person charged shall be taken into custody, the policeman shall take tho accuser, if unknown to him,
along with the accused, to the Recorder's court or
Police Station House, as the case may be; he shall
then, with as little delay as possible, return to his
beat, and inspect the same with great care, to see
that no depredations"have been committed during
his absence.
Sec 10. He shall carefully watch all disorderly
houses, or houses of evil repute within his beat,
and observe by whom they are frequented; and
report his observations to his commanding officer.
Sec. 11. He shall report to his commanding
officer all lamps that may not be lit at. the proper
.time, cleaned, or in any way out of order.","fullrs":{},"find":"2667.jp2","dmaccess":{},"dmimage":{},"dmcreated":"2012-01-18","dmmodified":"2012-01-18","dmoclcno":{},"dmrecord":"2666","restrictionCode":"1","cdmfilesize":"476795","cdmfilesizeformatted":"0.45 MB","cdmprintpdf":"0","cdmhasocr":"1","cdmisnewspaper":"0"}
